sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词都含"否定，否认，反驳，反对"之意。
means: contradict ： 指肯定地否认、反对或反驳某事，坚持相反的意见。
deny ： 普通用词，侧重否认意见或言论的真实性，尤指否定他人的指控或责难。
oppose ： 普通的广泛用词。指不作争论或不提出论据而无理由地反对；也指任何温和、有理由的反对或否定。
refute ： 语气较强，强调凭推理或证据驳斥一项主张或言论。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均含"反对"之意。
means: object ： 多指因厌恶或反感而反对，但不一定明显地表露出来。
oppose ： 普通用词，含义广，语气强于object。多指反对一些较重大的事，隐含其正当性。
resist ： 指用力量或意志抵抗、制止对方的入侵或诱惑、影响等。
protest ： 一般指通过言语或文字或行为表示出的强烈抗议、反对。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均含有"反抗，抵抗"之意。
means: oppose ： 普通用词，可表不同程度的抵抗。
defy ： 指公开地、勇敢地反对或抵抗，有时含公然挑衅之意。
withstand ： 较正式用词，指坚强地抵抗攻击或压力，有时也指抗住影响或吸引力。
resist ： 指积极地反抗一种攻击或暴力，或诱惑。

sentence.Network_en: It is illogical to oppose the repatriation of economic migrants.
sentence.Network_cn: 反对把经济移民遣送归国是不合逻辑的。

sentence.Network_en: This party would bitterly oppose the re-introduction of the death penalty.
sentence.Network_cn: 本党会强烈反对恢复死刑。

sentence.Network_en: The government called on the workers to oppose waste.
sentence.Network_cn: 政府号召工人反对浪费.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Old French opposer, from Latin opponere (see opponent), but influenced by Latin oppositus 'set or placed against' and Old French poser 'to place'

encyclopedia.content: 基本信息 oppose [E5pEuz] vt. 反对， 使对立， 使对抗， 抗争 vi. 反对 oppose op.pose AHD:[…-p½z“] D.J.[*6pouz] K.K.[*6poz] v.（动词） op.posed， op.pos.ing， op.pos.es v.tr.（及物动词） To be in contention or conflict with: 和…起冲突：与某事物对抗或冲突： oppose the enemy force. 和敌军起冲突 To be resistant to: 反抗，抗拒： opposes new ideas. 反对新的意见 To place opposite in contrast

entry.def: If you oppose someone or oppose their plans or ideas, you disagree with what they want to do and try to prevent them from doing it.

example.ex: Mr Taylor was not bitter towards those who had opposed him...
example.tran: 泰勒先生对那些曾反对过他的人并未怀恨在心。

example.ex: Many parents oppose bilingual education in schools.
example.tran: 很多家长反对学校实行双语教育。

sentences.sentence: "The senator said he would oppose the bill"

means.word_mean: 3. oppose with equal weight or force

"pit a chess player against the Russian champion"
"He plays his two children off against each other"

means.word_mean: 5. act against or in opposition to;

pose放→n.姿势,姿态 v.造成,提出,摆姿势,佯装

Sentence.sentence: In one 1990s experiment, a team including psychologist Joel Cooper of Princeton asked participants to write essays opposing funding for the disabled.
The rich are opposed to social welfare.
Despite this fact, many Americans are still strongly opposed to "big government.
Those who are opposed to it turn out to benefit most from it.

sentences.en: The old man can't bear anyone in the family to oppose him.
sentences.cn: 这位老人决不能容忍家里有人违抗他。

sentences.en: We opposed the proposal but to no avail.
sentences.cn: 我们反对这个提议, 但没用。

sentences.en: Politically, they belonged to the conservative party and opposed reform.
sentences.cn: 在政治上, 他们是保守派, 反对改革。

sentences.en: He had opposed Jim's entry right at the beginning.
sentences.cn: 从一开始他就反对吉姆参与。

sentences.en: They oppose each other also complement each other.
The government called on the workers to oppose waste.
sentences.cn: 政府号召工人反对浪费。

sentences.en: The husband strongly opposed his wife's going there alone.
sentences.cn: 丈夫极力反对妻子单独去那个地方。
